Identification.LongTitle: An Act respecting firearms and other weapons

Provision.Text: Her Majesty, by and with the advice and consent of the Senate and House of Commons of Canada, enacts as follows:

Section.Text: This Act may be cited as the Firearms Act.

Subsection.Text: In this Act,

Definition.Text: authorization to carry means an authorization described in section 20; (autorisation de port)

authorization to export means an authorization referred to in section 44 and includes a permit to export goods that is issued under the Export and Import Permits Act and that is deemed by regulations made under paragraph 117(a.1) to be an authorization to export; (autorisation d’exportation)
authorization to import means an authorization referred to in section 46; (autorisation d’importation)
authorization to transport means an authorization described in section 19; (autorisation de transport)
business means a person who carries on a business that includes

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the manufacture, assembly, possession, purchase, sale, importation, exportation, display, repair, restoration, maintenance, storage, alteration, pawnbroking, transportation, shipping, distribution or delivery of firearms, prohibited weapons, restricted weapons, prohibited devices or prohibited ammunition,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the possession, purchase or sale of ammunition, or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the purchase of cross-bows

Definition.Text: carrier means a person who carries on a transportation business that includes the transportation of firearms, prohibited weapons, restricted weapons, prohibited devices or prohibited ammunition; (transporteur)
chief firearms officer means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of a province, the individual who is designated in writing as the chief firearms officer for the province by the provincial minister of that province,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of a territory, the individual who is designated in writing as the chief firearms officer for the territory by the federal Minister, or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of any matter for which there is no chief firearms officer under paragraph (a) or (b), the individual who is designated in writing as the chief firearms officer for the matter by the federal Minister; (contrôleur des armes à feu)

Definition.Text: commencement day, in respect of a provision of this Act or the expression “former Act” in a provision of this Act, means the day on which the provision comes into force; (date de référence)
Commissioner means the Commissioner of Firearms appointed under section 81.1; (commissaire)

common-law partner, in relation to an individual, means a person who is cohabiting with the individual in a conjugal relationship, having so cohabited for a period of at least one year; (conjoint de fait)
customs office has the meaning assigned by subsection 2(1) of the Customs Act; (bureau de douane)
customs officer has the meaning assigned to the word “officer” by subsection 2(1) of the Customs Act; (agent des douanes)
federal Minister means the Minister of Public Safety and Emergency Preparedness; (ministre fédéral)
firearms officer means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of a province, an individual who is designated in writing as a firearms officer for the province by the provincial minister of that province,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of a territory, an individual who is designated in writing as a firearms officer for the territory by the federal Minister, or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of any matter for which there is no firearms officer under paragraph (a) or (b), an individual who is designated in writing as a firearms officer for the matter by the federal Minister; (préposé aux armes à feu)

Definition.Text: former Act means Part III of the Criminal Code, as it read from time to time before the commencement day; (loi antérieure)
museum means a person who operates a museum

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in which firearms, prohibited weapons, restricted weapons, prohibited devices or prohibited ammunition are possessed, bought, displayed, repaired, restored, maintained, stored or altered, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in which ammunition is possessed or bought; (musée)

Definition.Text: non-resident means an individual who ordinarily resides outside Canada; (non-résident)
prescribed means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a form or the information to be included on a form, prescribed by the federal Minister, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in any other case, prescribed by the regulations; (réglementaire)

Definition.Text: provincial minister means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of a province, the member of the executive council of the province who is designated by the lieutenant governor in council of the province as the provincial minister,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of a territory, the federal Minister, or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of any matter for which there is no provincial minister under paragraph (a) or (b), the federal Minister; (ministre provincial)

Definition.Text: regulations means regulations made by the Governor in Council under section 117. (règlements)

Subsection.MarginalNote: To be interpreted with Criminal Code
Subsection.Text: Unless otherwise provided, words and expressions used in this Act have the meanings assigned to them by section 2 or 84 of the Criminal Code. Subsections 117.15(3) and (4) of that Act apply to those words and expressions.

Sections 5, 9, 54 to 58, 67, 68 and 70 to 72 apply in respect of a carrier as if each reference in those sections to a chief firearms officer were a reference to the Registrar and for the purposes of applying section 6 in respect of a carrier, paragraph 113(3)(b) of the Criminal Code applies as if the reference in that section to a chief firearms officer were a reference to the Registrar.

For greater certainty, nothing in this Act shall be construed so as to abrogate or derogate from any existing aboriginal or treaty rights of the aboriginal peoples of Canada under section 35 of the Constitution Act, 1982.
This Act is binding on Her Majesty in right of Canada or a province.
Notwithstanding subsection (1), this Act does not apply in respect of the Canadian Forces.

Section.Text: The purpose of this Act is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to provide, notably by sections 5 to 16 and 54 to 73, for the issuance of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: licences for firearms and authorizations and registration certificates for prohibited firearms or restricted firearms, under which persons may possess firearms in circumstances that would otherwise constitute an offence under subsection 91(1), 92(1), 93(1) or 95(1) of the Criminal Code,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: licences and authorizations under which persons may possess prohibited weapons, restricted weapons, prohibited devices and prohibited ammunition in circumstances that would otherwise constitute an offence under subsection 91(2), 92(2) or 93(1) of the Criminal Code, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: licences under which persons may sell, barter or give cross-bows in circumstances that would otherwise constitute an offence under subsection 97(1) of the Criminal Code;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to authorize,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: notably by sections 5 to 12 and 54 to 73, the manufacture of or offer to manufacture, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: notably by sections 21 to 34 and 54 to 73, the transfer of or offer to transfer,

ContinuedParagraph.Text: firearms, prohibited weapons, restricted weapons, prohibited devices, ammunition and prohibited ammunition in circumstances that would otherwise constitute an offence under subsection 99(1), 100(1) or 101(1) of the Criminal Code; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: to authorize, notably by sections 35 to 73, the importation or exportation of firearms, prohibited weapons, restricted weapons, prohibited devices, ammunition, prohibited ammunition and components and parts designed exclusively for use in the manufacture of or assembly into automatic firearms in circumstances that would otherwise constitute an offence under subsection 103(1) or 104(1) of the Criminal Code.

Subsection.Text: A person is not eligible to hold a licence if it is desirable, in the interests of the safety of that or any other person, that the person not possess a firearm, a cross-bow, a prohibited weapon, a restricted weapon, a prohibited device, ammunition or prohibited ammunition.

In determining whether a person is eligible to hold a licence under subsection (1), a chief firearms officer or, on a reference under section 74, a provincial court judge shall have regard to whether the person, within the previous five years,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has been convicted or discharged under section 730 of the Criminal Code of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: an offence in the commission of which violence against another person was used, threatened or attempted,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: an offence under this Act or Part III of the Criminal Code,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: an offence under section 264 of the Criminal Code (criminal harassment),

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: an offence relating to the contravention of subsection 5(1) or (2), 6(1) or (2) or 7(1) of the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act, or

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: an offence relating to the contravention of subsection 9(1) or (2), 10(1) or (2), 11(1) or (2), 12(1), (4), (5), (6) or (7), 13(1) or 14(1) of the Cannabis Act;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has been treated for a mental illness, whether in a hospital, mental institute, psychiatric clinic or otherwise and whether or not the person was confined to such a hospital, institute or clinic, that was associated with violence or threatened or attempted violence on the part of the person against any person; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has a history of behaviour that includes violence or threatened or attempted violence on the part of the person against any person.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsection (2), in determining whether a non-resident who is 18 years old or older and by or on behalf of whom an application is made for a 60-day licence authorizing the non-resident to possess non-restricted firearms is eligible to hold a licence under subsection (1), a chief firearms officer or, on a reference under section 74, a provincial court judge may but need not have regard to the criteria described in subsection (2).

A person is eligible to hold a licence only if the person is not prohibited by a prohibition order from possessing any firearm, cross-bow, prohibited weapon, restricted weapon, prohibited device or prohibited ammunition.
Subsection (1) is subject to any order made under section 113 of the Criminal Code (lifting of prohibition order for sustenance or employment).
An individual is eligible to hold a licence only if the individual

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: successfully completes the Canadian Firearms Safety Course, as given by an instructor who is designated by a chief firearms officer, and passes the tests, as administered by an instructor who is designated by a chief firearms officer, that form part of that Course;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: passed, before the commencement day, the tests, as administered by an instructor who is designated by a chief firearms officer, that form part of that Course;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: successfully completed, before January 1, 1995, a course that the attorney general of the province in which the course was given had, during the period beginning on January 1, 1993 and ending on December 31, 1994, approved for the purposes of section 106 of the former Act;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: passed, before January 1, 1995, a test that the attorney general of the province in which the test was administered had, during the period beginning on January 1, 1993 and ending on December 31, 1994, approved for the purposes of section 106 of the former Act; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: on the commencement day, was an individual referred to in paragraph 7(4)(c) as it read immediately before that day and held a licence.

Subsection.Text: An individual is eligible to hold a licence authorizing the individual to possess prohibited firearms or restricted firearms only if the individual

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: successfully completes a restricted firearms safety course that is approved by the federal Minister, as given by an instructor who is designated by a chief firearms officer, and passes any tests, as administered by an instructor who is designated by a chief firearms officer, that form part of that course;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: passed, before the commencement day, a restricted firearms safety test, as administered by an instructor who is designated by a chief firearms officer, that is approved by the federal Minister; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: on the commencement day, was an individual referred to in paragraph 7(4)(c) as it read immediately before that day and held a licence authorizing the individual to possess prohibited firearms or restricted firearms.

Subsection.Text: An individual against whom a prohibition order was made

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is eligible to hold a licence only if the individual has, after the expiration of the prohibition order,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: successfully completed the Canadian Firearms Safety Course, as given by an instructor who is designated by a chief firearms officer, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: passed the tests, as administered by an instructor who is designated by a chief firearms officer, that form part of that Course; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is eligible to hold a licence authorizing the individual to possess restricted firearms only if the individual has, after the expiration of the prohibition order,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: successfully completed a restricted firearms safety course that is approved by the federal Minister, as given by an instructor who is designated by a chief firearms officer, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: passed any tests, as administered by an instructor who is designated by a chief firearms officer, that form part of that course.

Subsection.Text: Subsections (1) and (2) do not apply to an individual who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the prescribed circumstances, has been certified by a chief firearms officer as meeting the prescribed criteria relating to the safe handling and use of firearms and the laws relating to firearms;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is less than eighteen years old and requires a firearm to hunt or trap in order to sustain himself or herself or his or her family;

Text.Repealed: [Repealed, 2015, c. 27, s. 4]

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: requires a licence merely to acquire cross-bows; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: is a non-resident who is 18 years old or older and by or on behalf of whom an application is made for a 60-day licence authorizing the non-resident to possess non-restricted firearms.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (3) does not apply to an individual in respect of whom an order is made under section 113 of the Criminal Code (lifting of prohibition order for sustenance or employment) and who is exempted by a chief firearms officer from the application of that subsection.
An individual who is less than eighteen years old and who is otherwise eligible to hold a licence is not eligible to hold a licence except as provided in this section.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Minors hunting as a way of life
Subsection.Text: An individual who is less than eighteen years old and who hunts or traps as a way of life is eligible to hold a licence if the individual needs to hunt or trap in order to sustain himself or herself or his or her family.

An individual who is twelve years old or older but less than eighteen years old is eligible to hold a licence authorizing the individual to possess, in accordance with the conditions attached to the licence, a firearm for the purpose of target practice, hunting or instruction in the use of firearms or for the purpose of taking part in an organized competition.

An individual who is less than eighteen years old is not eligible to hold a licence authorizing the individual to possess prohibited firearms or restricted firearms or to acquire firearms or cross-bows.

An individual who is less than eighteen years old is eligible to hold a licence only if a parent or person who has custody of the individual has consented, in writing or in any other manner that is satisfactory to the chief firearms officer, to the issuance of the licence.

A business is eligible to hold a licence authorizing a particular activity only if every person who stands in a prescribed relationship to the business is eligible under sections 5 and 6 to hold a licence authorizing that activity or the acquisition of restricted firearms.
A business other than a carrier is eligible to hold a licence only if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a chief firearms officer determines that no individual who stands in a prescribed relationship to the business need be eligible to hold a licence under section 7; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the individuals who stand in a prescribed relationship to the business and who are determined by a chief firearms officer to be the appropriate individuals to satisfy the requirements of section 7 are eligible to hold a licence under that section.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (3.1), a business other than a carrier is eligible to hold a licence that authorizes the possession of firearms only if every employee of the business who, in the course of duties of employment, handles or would handle firearms is the holder of a licence authorizing the holder to acquire non-restricted firearms.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Employees — prohibited firearms or restricted firearms
Subsection.Text: A business other than a carrier is eligible to hold a licence that authorizes the possession of prohibited firearms or restricted firearms only if every employee of the business who, in the course of duties of employment, handles or would handle firearms is the holder of a licence authorizing the holder to acquire restricted firearms.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Employees — prohibited weapons, restricted weapons, etc.
Subsection.Text: A business other than a carrier is eligible to hold a licence that authorizes the possession of prohibited weapons, restricted weapons, prohibited devices or prohibited ammunition only if every employee of the business who, in the course of duties of employment, handles or would handle any of those things is eligible under sections 5 and 6 to hold a licence.
In subsection (3), “firearm” does not include a partially manufactured barrelled weapon that, in its unfinished state, is not a barrelled weapon

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: from which any shot, bullet or other projectile can be discharged; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that is capable of causing serious bodily injury or death to a person.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply in respect of a person who stands in a prescribed relationship to a business where a chief firearms officer determines that, in all the circumstances, the business should not be ineligible to hold a licence merely because of that person’s ineligibility.
Subsection (3) does not apply in respect of an employee of a museum

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: who, in the course of duties of employment, handles or would handle only firearms that are designed or intended to exactly resemble, or to resemble with near precision, antique firearms, and who has been trained to handle or use such a firearm; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: who is designated, by name, by a provincial minister.

Text.Repealed: [Repealed, 2003, c. 8, s. 13]

Heading.TitleText: Special Cases — Prohibited Firearms, Weapons, Devices and Ammunition

Section.MarginalNote: Prohibited firearms, weapons, devices and ammunition — businesses

Subsection.Text: A business that is otherwise eligible to hold a licence is not eligible to hold a licence authorizing the business to possess prohibited firearms, prohibited weapons, prohibited devices or prohibited ammunition except as provided in this section.

A business other than a carrier is eligible to hold a licence authorizing the business to possess prohibited firearms, prohibited weapons, prohibited devices or prohibited ammunition if the business needs to possess them for a prescribed purpose.
A carrier is eligible to hold a licence authorizing the carrier to possess prohibited firearms, prohibited weapons, prohibited devices or prohibited ammunition.
An individual who is otherwise eligible to hold a licence is not eligible to hold a licence authorizing the individual to possess prohibited firearms except as provided in this section.

An individual is eligible to hold a licence authorizing the individual to possess automatic firearms that, on the commencement day, were registered as restricted weapons under the former Act if the individual

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: on January 1, 1978 possessed one or more automatic firearms;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: on the commencement day held a registration certificate under the former Act for one or more automatic firearms; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: beginning on the commencement day was continuously the holder of a registration certificate for one or more automatic firearms.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Grandfathered individuals — pre-August 1, 1992 converted automatic firearms
Subsection.Text: An individual is eligible to hold a licence authorizing the individual to possess automatic firearms that have been altered to discharge only one projectile during one pressure of the trigger and that, on the commencement day, were registered as restricted weapons under the former Act if the individual

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: on August 1, 1992 possessed one or more automatic firearms

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: that had been so altered, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: for which on October 1, 1992 a registration certificate under the former Act had been issued or applied for;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: on the commencement day held a registration certificate under the former Act for one or more automatic firearms that had been so altered; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: beginning on the commencement day was continuously the holder of a registration certificate for one or more automatic firearms that have been so altered.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Grandfathered individuals — Prohibited Weapons Order, No. 12
Subsection.Text: An individual is eligible to hold a licence authorizing the individual to possess firearms that were declared to be prohibited weapons under the former Act by the Prohibited Weapons Order, No. 12, made by Order in Council P.C. 1992-1690 of July 23, 1992 and registered as SOR/92-471 and that, on October 1, 1992, either were registered as restricted weapons under the former Act or were the subject of an application for a registration certificate under the former Act if the individual

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: before July 27, 1992 possessed one or more firearms that were so declared;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: on the commencement day held a registration certificate under the former Act for one or more firearms that were so declared; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: beginning on the commencement day was continuously the holder of a registration certificate for one or more firearms that were so declared.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Grandfathered individuals — Prohibited Weapons Order, No. 13
Subsection.Text: An individual is eligible to hold a licence authorizing the individual to possess firearms that were declared to be prohibited weapons under the former Act by the Prohibited Weapons Order, No. 13, made by Order in Council P.C. 1994-1974 of November 29, 1994 and registered as SOR/94-741 and that, on January 1, 1995, either were registered as restricted weapons under the former Act or were the subject of an application for a registration certificate under the former Act if the individual

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: before January 1, 1995 possessed one or more firearms that were so declared;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: on the commencement day held a registration certificate under the former Act for one or more firearms that were so declared; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: beginning on the commencement day was continuously the holder of a registration certificate for one or more firearms that were so declared.

Subsection.Text: A particular individual is eligible to hold a licence authorizing that particular individual to possess a handgun referred to in subsection (6.1) if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: on December 1, 1998 the particular individual

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: held a registration certificate under the former Act for that kind of handgun, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: had applied for a registration certificate that was subsequently issued for that kind of handgun; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: beginning on December 1, 1998 the particular individual was continuously the holder of a registration certificate for that kind of handgun.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (6) applies in respect of a handgun

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that has a barrel equal to or less than 105 mm in length or that is designed or adapted to discharge a 25 or 32 calibre cartridge; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of which

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: on December 1, 1998 a registration certificate had been issued to an individual under the former Act,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: on December 1, 1998 a registration certificate had been applied for by an individual under the former Act, if the certificate was subsequently issued to the individual, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a record was sent before December 1, 1998 to the Commissioner of the Royal Canadian Mounted Police and received by that officer before, on or after that date.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Next of kin of grandfathered individuals
Subsection.Text: A particular individual is eligible to hold a licence authorizing the particular individual to possess a particular handgun referred to in subsection (6.1) that was manufactured before 1946 if the particular individual is the spouse or common-law partner or a brother, sister, child or grandchild of an individual who was eligible under this subsection or subsection (6) to hold a licence authorizing the individual to possess the particular handgun.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Grandfathered individuals — regulations re prohibited firearms
Subsection.Text: An individual is, in the prescribed circumstances, eligible to hold a licence authorizing the individual to possess firearms prescribed by a provision of regulations made by the Governor in Council under section 117.15 of the Criminal Code to be prohibited firearms if the individual

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: on the day on which the provision comes into force possesses one or more of those firearms; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: beginning on

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the day on which that provision comes into force, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of an individual who on that day did not hold but had applied for a registration certificate for one or more of those firearms, the day on which the registration certificate was issued

ContinuedParagraph.Text: was continuously the holder of a registration certificate for one or more of those firearms.

Subsection.Text: An individual is eligible to hold a licence authorizing the individual to possess prohibited firearms of a prescribed class if the individual

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: possesses one or more firearms of that class on a day that is prescribed with respect to that class;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: holds a registration certificate for one or more firearms of that class in the circumstances prescribed with respect to that class; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: was continuously the holder of a registration certificate for one or more firearms of that class beginning on the day that is prescribed — or that is determined under the regulations — with respect to that class.

Section.Text: A registration certificate may only be issued for a prohibited firearm or a restricted firearm.
A person is not eligible to hold a registration certificate for a firearm unless the person holds a licence authorizing the person to possess that kind of firearm.
A registration certificate may be issued only for a firearm

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that bears a serial number sufficient to distinguish it from other firearms; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that is described in the prescribed manner.

Section.Text: A registration certificate may not be issued for a firearm that is owned by Her Majesty in right of Canada or a province or by a police force.

Section.MarginalNote: Only one person per registration certificate

Subsection.Text: A registration certificate for a firearm may be issued to only one person.
Subsection (1) does not apply in the case of a firearm for which a registration certificate referred to in section 127 was issued to more than one person.

Section.MarginalNote: Places where prohibited and restricted firearms may be possessed
Section.Text: Subject to sections 19 and 20, a prohibited firearm or restricted firearm, the holder of the registration certificate for which is an individual, may be possessed only at the dwelling-house of the individual, as recorded in the Canadian Firearms Registry, or at a place authorized by a chief firearms officer.

Text.Repealed: [Repealed, 2003, c. 8, s. 15]

Section.MarginalNote: Transporting and using prohibited firearms or restricted firearms

Subsection.Text: An individual who holds a licence authorizing the individual to possess prohibited firearms or restricted firearms may be authorized to transport a particular prohibited firearm or restricted firearm between two or more specified places for any good and sufficient reason, including, without restricting the generality of the foregoing,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for use in target practice, or a target shooting competition, under specified conditions or under the auspices of a shooting club or shooting range that is approved under section 29;

Paragraph.Label: (a.1)
Paragraph.Text: to provide instructions in the use of firearms as part of a restricted firearms safety course that is approved by the federal Minister; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the individual

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: changes residence,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: wishes to transport the firearm to a peace officer, firearms officer or chief firearms officer for registration or disposal in accordance with this Act or Part III of the Criminal Code,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: wishes to transport the firearm for repair, storage, sale, exportation or appraisal, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: wishes to transport the firearm to a gun show.

Subsection.Text: In the case of an authorization to transport issued for a reason referred to in paragraph (1)(a) within the province where the holder of the authorization resides, the specified places must — except in the case of an authorization that is issued for a prohibited firearm referred to in subsection 12(9) — include all shooting clubs and shooting ranges that are approved under section 29 and that are located in that province.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Exception for prohibited firearms other than prohibited handguns
Subsection.Text: Despite subsection (1), an individual must not be authorized to transport a prohibited firearm — other than a handgun referred to in subsection 12(6.1) or a prohibited firearm referred to in subsection 12(9) — between specified places except for the purposes referred to in paragraph (1)(b).

Subsection.MarginalNote: Automatic authorization to transport — licence renewal
Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2.3), an individ­ual who holds a licence authorizing the individual to possess prohibited firearms or restricted firearms must, if the licence is renewed, be authorized to transport them within the individual’s province of residence

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to and from all shooting clubs and shooting ranges that are approved under section 29;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to and from any place a peace officer, firearms officer or chief firearms officer is located, for verification, registration or disposal in accordance with this Act or Part III of the Criminal Code;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: to and from a business that holds a licence authorizing it to repair or appraise prohibited firearms or restricted firearms;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: to and from a gun show; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: to a port of exit in order to take them outside Canada, and from a port of entry.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2.3), if a chief firearms officer has authorized the transfer of a prohibited firearm or a restricted firearm to an individual who holds a licence authorizing the individual to possess prohibited firearms or restricted firearms, the individual must be authorized

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to transport the firearm within the individual’s province of residence from the place where the individual acquires it to the place where they may possess it under section 17; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to transport their prohibited firearms and restricted firearms within the individual’s province of residence to and from the places referred to in any of paragraphs (2.1)(a) to (e).

Subsection.Text: An individual must not be authorized under subsection (2.1) or (2.2) to transport the following firearms to or from the places referred to in paragraph (2.1)(a):

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a prohibited firearm, other than a handgun referred to in subsection 12(6.1); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a restricted firearm or a handgun referred to in subsection 12(6.1) whose transfer was approved, in accordance with subparagraph 28(b)(ii), for the purpose of forming part of a gun collection.

Subsection.Text: A non-resident may be authorized to transport a particular restricted firearm between specified places in accordance with sections 35 and 35.1.

Section.MarginalNote: Carrying restricted firearms and pre-February 14, 1995 handguns
Section.Text: An individual who holds a licence authorizing the individual to possess restricted firearms or handguns referred to in subsection 12(6.1) (pre-December 1, 1998 handguns) may be authorized to possess a particular restricted firearm or handgun at a place other than the place at which it is authorized to be possessed if the individual needs the particular restricted firearm or handgun

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to protect the life of that individual or of other individuals; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for use in connection with his or her lawful profession or occupation.

Section.Text: For the purposes of sections 22 to 32, transfer means sell, barter or give.
A person may transfer or lend a firearm to an individual only if the person has no reason to believe that the individual

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has a mental illness that makes it desirable, in the interests of the safety of that individual or any other person, that the individual not possess a firearm; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is impaired by alcohol or a drug.

Section.Text: A person may transfer a non-restricted firearm if, at the time of the transfer,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the transferee holds a licence authorizing the transferee to acquire and possess that kind of firearm; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the transferor has no reason to believe that the transferee is not authorized to acquire and possess that kind of firearm.

Subsection.Text: A transferor referred to in section 23 may request that the Registrar inform the transferor as to whether the transferee, at the time of the transfer, holds and is still eligible to hold the licence referred to in paragraph 23(a), and if such a request is made, the Registrar or his or her delegate, or any other person that the federal Minister may designate, shall so inform the transferor.

Despite sections 12 and 13 of the Library and Archives of Canada Act and subsections 6(1) and (3) of the Privacy Act, neither the Registrar or his or her delegate nor a designated person shall retain any record of a request made under subsection (1).

Section.MarginalNote: Authorization to transfer prohibited or restricted firearms

Subsection.Text: A person may transfer a prohibited firearm or a restricted firearm if, at the time of the transfer,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the transferee holds a licence authorizing the transferee to acquire and possess that kind of firearm;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the transferor has no reason to believe that the transferee is not authorized to acquire and possess that kind of firearm;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the transferor informs the Registrar of the transfer;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if the transferee is an individual, the transferor informs a chief firearms officer of the transfer and obtains the authorization of the chief firearms officer for the transfer;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a new registration certificate for the firearm is issued in accordance with this Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the prescribed conditions are met.

Subsection.Text: If, after being informed of a proposed transfer of a firearm, the Registrar decides to refuse to issue a registration certificate for the firearm, the Registrar shall inform a chief firearms officer of that decision.

Section.MarginalNote: Authorization to transfer prohibited weapons, devices and ammunition

Subsection.Text: Subject to section 26, a person may transfer a prohibited weapon, prohibited device or prohibited ammunition only to a business.
A person may transfer a prohibited weapon, prohibited device, ammunition or prohibited ammunition to a business only if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the business holds a licence authorizing the business to acquire and possess prohibited weapons, prohibited devices, ammunition or prohibited ammunition, as the case may be; and

Text.Repealed: [Repealed, 2003, c. 8, s. 18]

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the person has no reason to believe that the business is not authorized to acquire and possess prohibited weapons, prohibited devices, ammunition or prohibited ammunition, as the case may be.

Text.Repealed: [Repealed before coming into force, 2008, c. 20, s. 3]

Section.MarginalNote: Authorization to transfer ammunition to individuals
Section.Text: A person may transfer ammunition that is not prohibited ammunition to an individual only if the individual

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: until January 1, 2001, holds a licence authorizing him or her to possess firearms or a prescribed document; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: after January 1, 2001, holds a licence authorizing him or her to possess firearms.

Section.MarginalNote: Authorization to transfer prohibited or restricted firearms to Crown, etc.

Subsection.Text: A person may transfer a prohibited firearm or a restricted firearm to Her Majesty in right of Canada or a province, to a police force or to a municipality if the person informs the Registrar of the transfer and complies with the prescribed conditions.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Authorization to transfer prohibited weapons, etc., to the Crown, etc.
Subsection.Text: A person may transfer a prohibited weapon, restricted weapon, prohibited device, ammunition or prohibited ammunition to Her Majesty in right of Canada or a province, to a police force or to a municipality if the person informs a chief firearms officer of the transfer and complies with the prescribed conditions.

Section.Text: On being informed of a proposed transfer of a prohibited firearm or restricted firearm under section 23.2, a chief firearms officer shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: verify

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: whether the transferee or individual holds a licence,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: whether the transferee or individual is still eligible to hold that licence, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: whether the licence authorizes the transferee or individual to acquire that kind of firearm or to acquire prohibited weapons, prohibited devices, ammunition or prohibited ammunition, as the case may be;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a proposed transfer of a restricted firearm or a handgun referred to in subsection 12(6.1) (pre-December 1, 1998 handguns), verify the purpose for which the transferee or individual wishes to acquire the restricted firearm or handgun and determine whether the particular restricted firearm or handgun is appropriate for that purpose;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: decide whether to approve the transfer and inform the Registrar of that decision; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: take the prescribed measures.

Section.Text: A chief firearms officer may approve the transfer to an individual of a restricted firearm or a handgun referred to in subsection 12(6.1) (pre-December 1, 1998 handguns) only if the chief firearms officer is satisfied

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that the individual needs the restricted firearm or handgun

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: to protect the life of that individual or of other individuals, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: for use in connection with his or her lawful profession or occupation; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that the purpose for which the individual wishes to acquire the restricted firearm or handgun is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: for use in target practice, or a target shooting competition, under conditions specified in an authorization to transport or under the auspices of a shooting club or shooting range that is approved under section 29, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: to form part of a gun collection of the individual, in the case of an individual who satisfies the criteria described in section 30.

Subsection.Text: No person shall operate a shooting club or shooting range except under an approval of the provincial minister for the province in which the premises of the shooting club or shooting range are located.
A provincial minister may approve a shooting club or shooting range for the purposes of this Act if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the shooting club or shooting range complies with the regulations made under paragraph 117(e); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the premises of the shooting club or shooting range are located in that province.

Subsection.Text: A provincial minister who approves a shooting club or shooting range for the purposes of this Act may revoke the approval for any good and sufficient reason including, without limiting the generality of the foregoing, where the shooting club or shooting range contravenes a regulation made under paragraph 117(e).

A chief firearms officer who is authorized in writing by a provincial minister may perform such duties and functions of the provincial minister under this section as are specified in the authorization.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Notice of refusal to approve or revocation
Subsection.Text: Where a provincial minister decides to refuse to approve or to revoke an approval of a shooting club or shooting range for the purposes of this Act, the provincial minister shall give notice of the decision to the shooting club or shooting range.
A notice given under subsection (5) must include reasons for the decision disclosing the nature of the information relied on for the decision and must be accompanied by a copy of sections 74 to 81.
A provincial minister need not disclose any information the disclosure of which could, in the opinion of the provincial minister, endanger the safety of any person.

Section.Text: The criteria referred to in subparagraph 28(b)(ii) are that the individual

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has knowledge of the historical, technological or scientific characteristics that relate or distinguish the restricted firearms or handguns that he or she possesses;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has consented to the periodic inspection, conducted in a reasonable manner, of the premises in which the restricted firearms or handguns are to be kept; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has complied with such other requirements as are prescribed respecting knowledge, secure storage and the keeping of records in respect of restricted firearms or handguns.

Subsection.Text: On being informed of a proposed transfer of a firearm, the Registrar may

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: issue a new registration certificate for the firearm in accordance with this Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: revoke any registration certificate for the firearm held by the transferor.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Transfers of firearms to the Crown, etc.
Subsection.Text: On being informed of a transfer of a firearm to Her Majesty in right of Canada or a province, to a police force or to a municipality, the Registrar shall revoke any registration certificate for the firearm.

Section.Text: A person may transfer a firearm by mail only if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the verifications, notifications, issuances and authorizations referred to in sections 21 to 28, 30, 31, 40 to 43 and 46 to 52 take place within a reasonable period before the transfer in the prescribed manner; and

Text.Repealed: [Repealed, 2003, c. 8, s. 24]

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the prescribed conditions are complied with.

Section.Text: Subject to section 34, a person may lend a firearm only if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: has reasonable grounds to believe that the borrower holds a licence authorizing the borrower to possess that kind of firearm, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a prohibited firearm or a restricted firearm, lends the registration certificate for it to the borrower; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the borrower uses the firearm under the direct and immediate supervision of the person in the same manner in which the person may lawfully use it.

Section.MarginalNote: Authorization to lend firearms, etc., to the Crown, etc.
Section.Text: A person may lend a firearm, prohibited weapon, restricted weapon, prohibited device, ammunition or prohibited ammunition to Her Majesty in right of Canada or a province, to a police force or to a municipality if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a prohibited firearm or a restricted firearm, the transferor lends the registration certificate for it to the borrower; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the prescribed conditions are complied with.

Section.MarginalNote: Authorization for non-residents who do not hold a licence to import firearms that are not prohibited firearms

Subsection.Text: A non-resident who does not hold a licence may import a firearm that is not a prohibited firearm if, at the time of the importation,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the non-resident

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: is eighteen years old or older,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: declares the firearm to a customs officer in the prescribed manner and, in the case of a declaration in writing, completes the prescribed form containing the prescribed information, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a restricted firearm, produces an authorization to transport the restricted firearm; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a customs officer confirms in the prescribed manner the declaration referred to in subparagraph (a)(ii) and the authorization to transport referred to in subparagraph (a)(iii).

Subsection.Text: Where a firearm is declared at a customs office to a customs officer but the requirements of subparagraphs (1)(a)(ii) and (iii) are not complied with, the customs officer may authorize the firearm to be exported from that customs office or may detain the firearm and give the non-resident a reasonable time to comply with those requirements.
Where those requirements are not complied with within a reasonable time and the firearm is not exported, the firearm shall be disposed of in the prescribed manner.
If a non-restricted firearm is declared at a customs office to a customs officer and

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the non-resident has not truthfully completed the prescribed form, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the customs officer has reasonable grounds to believe that it is desirable, in the interests of the safety of the non-resident or any other person, that the declaration not be confirmed,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: the customs officer may refuse to confirm the declaration and may authorize the firearm to be exported from that customs office.

Subsection.Text: A declaration that is confirmed under paragraph 35(1)(b) has the same effect after the importation of the firearm as a licence authorizing the non-resident to possess only that firearm and, in the case of a restricted firearm, as a registration certificate for the firearm until

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the expiry of 60 days after the importation, in the case of a non-restricted firearm; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the earlier of the expiry of 60 days after the importation and the expiry of the authorization to transport, in the case of a restricted firearm.

Subsection.Text: A chief firearms officer may renew the confirmation of a declaration for one or more periods of sixty days.

For greater certainty, an application for a renewal of the confirmation of a declaration may be made by telephone or other electronic means or by mail and a chief firearms officer may renew that confirmation by electronic means or by mail.

Subsection.Text: A licence, registration certificate or authorization, other than an authorization referred to in subsection 19(2.1) or (2.2), may be issued only on application made in the prescribed form — which form may be in writing or electronic — or in the prescribed manner. The application must set out the prescribed information and be accompanied by payment of the prescribed fees.
An application for a licence, registration certificate or authorization must be made to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a chief firearms officer, in the case of a licence, an authorization to carry or an authorization to transport; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Registrar, in the case of a registration certificate, an authorization to export or an authorization to import.

Subsection.Text: An individual who, on the commencement day, possesses one or more restricted firearms or one or more handguns referred to in subsection 12(6.1) (pre-December 1, 1998 handguns) must specify, in any application for a licence authorizing the individual to possess restricted firearms or handguns that are so referred to,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: except in the case of a firearm described in paragraph (b), for which purpose described in section 28 the individual wishes to continue to possess restricted firearms or handguns that are so referred to; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for which of those firearms was a registration certificate under the former Act issued because they were relics, were of value as a curiosity or rarity or were valued as a memento, remembrance or souvenir.

Subsection.Text: A chief firearms officer or the Registrar may require an applicant for a licence or authorization to submit such information, in addition to that included in the application, as may reasonably be regarded as relevant for the purpose of determining whether the applicant is eligible to hold the licence or authorization.

Without restricting the scope of the inquiries that may be made with respect to an application for a licence, a chief firearms officer may conduct an investigation of the applicant, which may consist of interviews with neighbours, community workers, social workers, individuals who work or live with the applicant, spouse or common-law partner, former spouse or former common-law partner, dependants or whomever in the opinion of the chief firearms officer may provide information pertaining to whether the applicant is eligible under section 5 to hold a licence.
A chief firearms officer is responsible for issuing licences.
Only one licence may be issued to any one individual.
A business other than a carrier requires a separate licence for each place where the business is carried on.

Section.Text: A chief firearms officer is responsible for issuing authorizations to carry and authorizations to transport.

Subsection.Text: A chief firearms officer who issues a licence, an authorization to carry or an authorization to transport may attach any reasonable condition to it that the chief firearms officer considers desirable in the particular circumstances and in the interests of the safety of the holder or any other person.
However, a chief firearms officer’s power to attach a condition to a licence, an authorization to carry or an authorization to transport is subject to the regulations.

Before attaching a condition to a licence that is to be issued to an individual who is less than eighteen years old and who is not eligible to hold a licence under subsection 8(2) (minors hunting as a way of life), a chief firearms officer must consult with a parent or person who has custody of the individual.

Before issuing a licence to an individual who is less than eighteen years old and who is not eligible to hold a licence under subsection 8(2) (minors hunting as a way of life), a chief firearms officer shall have a parent or person who has custody of the individual sign the licence, including any conditions attached to it.

Section.Text: An individual who holds an authorization to carry or authorization to transport need not be the person to whom the registration certificate for the particular prohibited firearm or restricted firearm was issued.

Section.MarginalNote: Registration certificates and authorizations to export or import
Section.Text: The Registrar is responsible for issuing registration certificates for prohibited firearms and restricted firearms and assigning firearms identification numbers to them and for issuing authorizations to export and authorizations to import.

Subsection.Text: A licence or registration certificate must be issued in the prescribed form — which form may be in writing or electronic — or in the prescribed manner, and include the prescribed information, including any conditions attached to it.

An authorization to carry, authorization to transport, authorization to export or authorization to import may be issued in the prescribed form — which form may be in writing or electronic — or in the prescribed manner, and include the prescribed information, including any conditions attached to it.
An authorization to carry or authorization to transport may take the form of a condition attached to a licence.
An authorization to transport referred to in subsection 19(1.1), (2.1) or (2.2) must take the form of a condition attached to a licence.

A licence that is issued to a business must specify each particular activity that the licence authorizes in relation to firearms, cross-bows, prohibited weapons, restricted weapons, prohibited devices, ammunition or prohibited ammunition.

Section.Text: Licences, registration certificates, authorizations to carry, authorizations to transport, authorizations to export and authorizations to import are not transferable.

Subsection.Text: Licences, registration certificates, authorizations to transport, authorizations to export and authorizations to import are valid throughout Canada.

Text.Repealed: [Repealed, 2003, c. 8, s. 39]

Subsection.Text: Authorizations to carry are not valid outside the province in which they are issued.
A licence that is issued to an individual who is eighteen years old or older expires on the earlier of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: five years after the birthday of the holder next following the day on which it is issued, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the expiration of the period for which it is expressed to be issued.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsection (1), if a licence for firearms is not renewed before it expires, the licence is extended for a period of six months beginning on the day on which it would have expired under that subsection.
The holder of a licence that is extended under subsection (1.1) must not, until the renewal of their licence, use their firearms or acquire any firearms or ammunition.

The extension of a licence under subsection (1.1) does not result in the extension of any authorization to carry or authorization to transport beyond the day on which the licence would have expired under subsection (1).
During the extension period, the following authorizations must not be issued to the holder of the licence:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an authorization to carry; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an authorization to transport, unless it is issued

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: for a reason referred to in subparagraph 19(1)(b)(i) or (ii), or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: because the holder wishes to transport a firearm for disposal through sale or exportation.

Subsection.Text: A licence that is issued to an individual who is less than eighteen years old expires on the earlier of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the day on which the holder attains the age of eighteen years, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the expiration of the period for which it is expressed to be issued.

Subsection.Text: A licence that is issued to a business other than a business referred to in subsection (4) expires on the earlier of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: three years after the day on which it is issued, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the expiration of the period for which it is expressed to be issued.

Subsection.Text: A licence that is issued to a business that sells ammunition but is not authorized to possess firearms, prohibited weapons, restricted weapons, prohibited devices or prohibited ammunition expires on the earlier of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: five years after the day on which it is issued, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the expiration of the period for which it is expressed to be issued.

Text.Repealed: [Repealed before coming into force, 2008, c. 20, s. 3]

Subsection.Text: The chief firearms officer shall give notice of every extension under this section to the holder of the licence.
Subject to subsections (2) to (4), an authorization expires on the expiration of the period for which it is expressed to be issued.
Subject to subsection (3), an authorization to transport that takes the form of a condition attached to a licence expires on the earlier of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the expiration of the period for which the condition is expressed to be attached, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the expiration of the licence.

Subsection.Text: An authorization to transport a prohibited firearm, except for an automatic firearm, or a restricted firearm for use in target practice, or a target shooting competition, under specified conditions or under the auspices of a shooting club or shooting range that is approved under section 29, whether or not the authorization takes the form of a condition attached to the licence of the holder of the authorization, expires on the earlier of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the expiration of the period for which the authorization is expressed to be issued, which period may be no more than five years, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the expiration of the licence.

Subsection.Text: An authorization to carry expires

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an authorization to carry that takes the form of a condition attached to a licence, on the earlier of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the expiration of the period for which the condition is expressed to be attached, which period may not be more than two years, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the expiration of the licence; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an authorization to carry that does not take the form of a condition attached to a licence, on the expiration of the period for which the authorization is expressed to be issued, which period may not be more than two years.

Section.Text: A registration certificate for a prohibited firearm or a restricted firearm expires when

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the holder of the registration certificate ceases to be the owner of the firearm; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the firearm ceases to be a firearm.

Subsection.Text: A chief firearms officer may renew a licence, authorization to carry or authorization to transport in the prescribed manner.

On renewing a licence authorizing an individual to possess restricted firearms or handguns referred to in subsection 12(6.1) (pre-December 1, 1998 handguns), a chief firearms officer shall decide whether any of those firearms or handguns that the individual possesses are being used for a purpose described in section 28.

A chief firearms officer who decides that any restricted firearms or any handguns referred to in subsection 12(6.1) (pre-December 1, 1998 handguns) that are possessed by an individual are not being used for that purpose shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: give notice of that decision in the prescribed form to the individual; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: inform the Registrar of that decision.

Subsection.Text: Subsections (2) and (3) do not apply to a firearm

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that is a relic, is of value as a curiosity or rarity or is valued as a memento, remembrance or souvenir;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that was specified in the licence application as being a firearm for which a registration certificate under the former Act was issued because the firearm was a relic, was of value as a curiosity or rarity or was valued as a memento, remembrance or souvenir;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: for which a registration certificate under the former Act was issued because the firearm was a relic, was of value as a curiosity or rarity or was valued as a memento, remembrance or souvenir; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of which an individual, on the commencement day, held a registration certificate under the former Act.

Subsection.Text: A notice given under paragraph (3)(a) must include the reasons for the decision and be accompanied by a copy of sections 74 to 81.

Section.Text: A chief firearms officer shall refuse to issue a licence if the applicant is not eligible to hold one and may refuse to issue an authorization to carry or authorization to transport for any good and sufficient reason.

The Registrar may refuse to issue a registration certificate, authorization to export or authorization to import for any good and sufficient reason including, in the case of an application for a registration certificate, where the applicant is not eligible to hold a registration certificate.

Subsection.Text: A chief firearms officer may revoke a licence, an authorization to carry or an authorization to transport for any good and sufficient reason including, without limiting the generality of the foregoing,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: where the holder of the licence or authorization

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: is no longer or never was eligible to hold the licence or authorization,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: contravenes any condition attached to the licence or authorization, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: has been convicted or discharged under section 730 of the Criminal Code of an offence referred to in paragraph 5(2)(a); or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: where, in the case of a business, a person who stands in a prescribed relationship to the business has been convicted or discharged under section 730 of the Criminal Code of any such offence.

Subsection.Text: The Registrar may revoke an authorization to export or authorization to import for any good and sufficient reason.
The Registrar

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: may revoke a registration certificate for a prohibited firearm or a restricted firearm for any good and sufficient reason; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall revoke a registration certificate for a firearm held by an individual where the Registrar is informed by a chief firearms officer under section 67 that the firearm is not being used for a purpose described in section 28.

Subsection.Text: A registration certificate for a prohibited firearm referred to in subsection 12(3) (pre-August 1, 1992 converted automatic firearms) is automatically revoked on the change of any alteration in the prohibited firearm that was described in the application for the registration certificate.

Section.MarginalNote: Notice of refusal to issue or revocation

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (1.1), if a chief firearms officer decides to refuse to issue or to revoke a licence or authorization to transport or the Registrar decides to refuse to issue or to revoke a registration certificate, authorization to export or authorization to import, the chief firearms officer or Registrar shall give notice of the decision in the prescribed form to the applicant for or holder of the licence, registration certificate or authorization.
Notice under subsection (1) need not be given in any of the following circumstances:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the holder has requested that the licence, registration certificate or authorization be revoked; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the revocation is incidental to the issuance of a new licence, registration certificate or authorization.

Subsection.Text: A notice given under subsection (1) must include reasons for the decision disclosing the nature of the information relied on for the decision and must be accompanied by a copy of sections 74 to 81.

A chief firearms officer or the Registrar need not disclose any information the disclosure of which could, in the opinion of the chief firearms officer or the Registrar, endanger the safety of any person.

A notice given under subsection (1) in respect of a licence must specify a reasonable period during which the applicant for or holder of the licence may deliver to a peace officer or a firearms officer or a chief firearms officer or otherwise lawfully dispose of any firearm, prohibited weapon, restricted weapon, prohibited device or prohibited ammunition that the applicant for or holder of the licence possesses and during which sections 91, 92 and 94 of the Criminal Code do not apply to the applicant or holder.

A notice given under subsection (1) in respect of a registration certificate for a prohibited firearm or a restricted firearm must specify a reasonable period during which the applicant for or holder of the registration certificate may deliver to a peace officer or a firearms officer or a chief firearms officer or otherwise lawfully dispose of the firearm to which the registration certificate relates and during which sections 91, 92 and 94 of the Criminal Code do not apply to the applicant or holder.

If the applicant for or holder of the licence or registration certificate refers the refusal to issue it or revocation of it to a provincial court judge under section 74, the reasonable period of time does not begin until after the reference is finally disposed of.
